Authors: Santy, Nugroho B.S., August V., Maharlian G.
Title: Feasibility study and prototype design of freelancer online marketplace
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santy, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nugroho, B.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; August, V., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maharlian, G., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to conduct feasibility study and design a prototype of freelancer online marketplace. This platform can help freelancers in Indonesia in finding project opportunities. Moreover, project owners who need people to work on their projects will be facilitated by this online marketplace. To see the feasibility we analyzed the current market situation and then design the freelancer online marketplace platform. Data are collected by distributing questionnaires and literature reviews have also been done to collect information regarding trend of online marketplace. We also use object-oriented method to analyze and design the freelancer online marketplace. Freelancer Online Marketplace provides business-driven service in collaborative way whereby it can be an opportunity for freelancers to find new job opportunities, increase their skills, and develop new experiences and portfolios. On the other Freelance Online Marketplace could be an effective option realizing or implementing an idea into a real finish product for Project Owners. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Freelance; Freelancer; Marketplace; Online marketplace; Project owner
Index Keywords: Information management; Planning; Surveys; Feasibility studies; Job opportunities; Literature reviews; Market situation; Object oriented method; On-line marketplaces; Project owners; Prototype designs; Electronic commerce

Title: Consumer Preferences for the e-CRM Interface of an Indonesian Venture Capital Firm
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santy, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hardiyanti, V.P.M., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to analyze Consumer Preferences for the e-CRM Interface of an Indonesian Venture Capital Firm and to give recommendations on user interface for venture capital firm who would like to develop their eCRM. Data and information were gathered by performing interview and questionnaire to 91 customers of the Indonesian venture capital firm. Conjoint analysis was used to explore the output elements of the 7C Framework which resulted on the customer preferences towards the e-CRM interface. This paper recommends a framework for Consumer Preferences for the eCRM Interface of an Indonesian Venture Capital Firm. A survey on a for the website interface of Venture Capital Firm is rarely conducted in Indonesia; therefore, this result will be beneficial for developing Indonesian Venture Capital Firm websites. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: consumer preference; e-CRM; interface; venture capital firm
Index Keywords: Information management; Interfaces (materials); Surveys; User interfaces; Websites; Conjoint analysis; Consumer preferences; Customer preferences; Data and information; Indonesia; Venture capital firms; Website interfaces; Investments

Title: E-dopt: A mobile application for pet adoption in Indonesia
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santy, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Karuna, R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiman, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this research, we discuss the current trend on pet adoption in Indonesia and introduce a mobile application called e-dopt to encourage more pet adoption in Indonesia. Pet adoption mobile application is not yet popular in Indonesia, thus the benefit of conducting this research. Within this research, a mobile application to help the pet adoption process has been developed. The mobile application is developed on Android platform and the requirements are gathered by interviews, surveys, and research that have been conducted. The mobile application developed provides convenience for those who wants to adopt or give out pets and also allows businesses in pet product industry to use the mobile application as a sales channel. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Animal adoption; E-dopt; Mobile application; Pet adoption; Pet e-dopt

Title: Interaction and learning model in e-learning using learning management system
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Department of Information Systems, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santy, Bina Nusantara University, Department of Information Systems, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kurniali, S., Bina Nusantara University, Department of Information Systems, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, Indonesia; Indrajani, Bina Nusantara University, Department of Information Systems, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: It is important for learners to be able interact and learn, even in an e-learning environment. The study focus on developing a model of interactions with the components within the learning environment along with the Learning Management System features that can be used to support the interactions. In this paper we propose an Interaction and Learning Model in E-learning using Learning Management System (LMS). In this approach the LMS acts as a hub that connects every actor and element in the e-learning and acts as a platform where all the e-learning activities will take place. The model emphasizes the relation between the learner's interactions and learning to the type of e-learning and features practiced inside a LMS. © 2005 – on going JATIT & LLS.
Author Keywords: E-learning; Features in LMS; Interaction; Interaction model; Learning model; LMS

Title: Sourcing lifecycle for software as a service (SAAS)
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, School of Information System, 11480 Jakarta, Indonesia; University of Twente, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Math and Comp. Science, 7500 AE Enschede, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Santy, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information System, 11480 Jakarta, Indonesia; Sikkel, K., University of Twente, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Math and Comp. Science, 7500 AE Enschede, Netherlands
Abstract: In recent years, Software as a Service (SaaS) has changed from curiosity caused concept to an accepted well known concept. A key advantage of this model is that, by cautious engineering, it is possible to influence economy of scale to decrease total cost of ownership compared to on-premises solutions. By using the guideline elaborated in this paper, companies which has interest in implementing SaaS will be led throughout the entire implementation cycle starting before the company decides to implement SaaS until the stage when the company decides to shift from SaaS model to another model or when they shift to another SaaS company © Owned by the authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2014.

Authors: Salman A.G., Kanigoro B., Rojali, Kevin, Santy
Title: Application hiding messages in JPEG images with the method of bit-plane complexity segmentation on android-based mobile devices
Affiliations: BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Salman, A.G., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kanigoro, B., BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Rojali, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Kevin, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia; Santy, BINUS University, Jl K.H Syahdan No.9, Jakarta Barat, Jakarta,11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Communications world is growing rapidly in this all-digital era and the importance of the need for a secure and reliable communication is increasing as response to the criminality problems, such as message interceptor problem. By looking at these requirements, a safer way to communicate, such as Cryptography, has been developed. However, the result of this method is not sufficient, because it still risk from the interception of the sent data, caused by cryptography which only hides the data resulting the packaging to be suspicious and draw attention of the hijackers. Therefore, Steganography then developed in which not only hides the content, but also deceptive hijackers with packaging that is not suspicious. In this paper, we discuss the design of steganography which is applied in mobile devices (e.g. mobile phone) using the BPCS (Bit-Plane Complexity Segmentation) by hiding text message into the media reservoir of JPEG data types images. When using this method the message hiding capacity is larger than any other method, up to 40% of the image container. The simulation result reconstructed images which is measured by an objective assessment parameters, based on the Peak Signal to Noise Ratio PSNR, with efficient value obtained on average is 74.3294 dB which is well worth the image quality. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
